text: confidence is one of the most
sought-after traits in the world however
for the majority of us it seems as if
it's something you're either born with
or without that's funny to think about
because the definition of confidence is
actually once trust in one's ability to
get something done and as we all know
Trust isn't something that just appears
it's something that must be built and
obtained over time a close friend of
mine named Jessie can sit down and
perform in front of hundreds of people
without hesitation on a scale of one to
five one being absolutely no confidence
whatsoever
two five being over filling with
confidence Jessie is a solid five but
Jessie wasn't always as confident in his
guitar playing abilities nor was he any
good
he was able to build this confidence
over time using something called
reference experiences now reference
experiences are key experiences that
change the way that you view yourself
they are events big enough important
enough outside of your comfort zone
enough that they affect how you view
yourself as a person now 15 years ago
when Jessie first picked up that guitar
he didn't know what he was doing his
confidence in the skill was almost zero
and if you tried to get him to go on a
stage and perform in front of hundreds
of people he would run he would sprint
the other way he didn't think of himself
as a good guitar player because he
didn't have any reference experiences
backing up this claim his first
reference experience was when he learned
how to play his first song he practiced
by himself in his bedroom and it took a
couple of days just to get down the
chords another week to get down the
course for the song eventually he
learned how to play an entire song all
by himself
this marks his first reference
experience he began to see himself as a
guitar player a few months later after
practicing on a daily basis
Jessie found himself with an opportunity
to present his talent in front of his
close friends he grabs onto this
opportunity and jumps outside his
comfort zone he plays a song that he's
been practicing over and over again in
his bedroom
his friends applaud and they compliment
him on his new
skill this reference experience marks
the first time Jessie was able to play
in front of others
so his confidence as guitar playing
Rises yet again a year later he finds
himself at a party at a friend's house
and this friend happens to also have a
guitar during the party and under the
slight influence of liquid courage and
encouragement from his friend Jesse
plays one of his favorite songs in front
of a small crowd of twenty people his
performance was good and the crowd all
applauded at the end he gained yet
another reference experience and his
confidence in his guitar playing Rises
yet again this is the first time Jesse
played in front of strangers and he
starts to think of himself as a good
guitar player couple of years after that
Jesse starts performing on the streets
of New York play his music for subway
commuters he plays in front of strangers
and receives money for his performances
now this built an enormous amount of
confidence within him he starts seeing
himself as an excellent guitar player
he's good enough to get paid for his
skill gaining reference experiences is
one of the most effective ways to
jumpstart your confidence in whatever
field area or skill that you'd like
listed below are some areas in which I
feel fairly confident about along with
the reference experiences that brought
me to that stage if you guys have any
issues or questions coming up with your
own reference experiences for whatever
field skill or area please leave a
comment below and I'd be glad to help
you come up with some suggestions
